posts.post_content: Most Magic players seem to have their own giant Timmy creature that they fell in love with before realizing a deck can have more than giant creatures, and this one is mine. Back then, all I needed to see were those two beautiful numbers down there and I knew I had to have it. I even still used it as a finisher when I moved on to more controlling builds. Now, it occupies the very first spot in my tradebook until another bright-eyed young Timmy sees those two 11s and goes giddy with excitement.
posts.html:
Most Magic players seem to have their own giant Timmy creature that they fell in love with before realizing a deck can have more than giant creatures, and this one is mine. Back then, all I needed to see were those two beautiful numbers down there and I knew I had to have it. I even still used it as a finisher when I moved on to more controlling builds. Now, it occupies the very first spot in my tradebook until another bright-eyed young Timmy sees those two 11s and goes giddy with excitement.

Posted By: Budden (12/19/2011 12:05:37 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Delightfully silly and one of the few huge blue "Leviathan" style creatures that was actually playable in semi-serious decks, namely reanimation back in the day. Has almost now practically useless these days, though I suppose a person with a sense of humor could make some sort of EDH / Commander deck full of these crazy, huge blue creatures.
  
   
Finally, there are ways to make its upkeep into an advantage (Land Tax, Balance, etc.) or at least work around it (Life from the Loam, Crucible of Worlds, etc.)
posts.html:
Delightfully silly and one of the few huge blue "Leviathan" style creatures that was actually playable in semi-serious decks, namely reanimation back in the day. Has almost now practically useless these days, though I suppose a person with a sense of humor could make some sort of EDH / Commander deck full of these crazy, huge blue creatures.

Finally, there are ways to make its upkeep into an advantage (Land Tax, Balance, etc.) or at least work around it (Life from the Loam, Crucible of Worlds, etc.)
